alert.note: Alert for Furnas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 8:38AM CDT until May 29 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Cambridge affecting Furnas County. For the REPUBLICAN RIVER...including Cambridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Republican River At Cambridge, eastward to the Furnas and Harlan County line. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs as the right bank overflows. Water will start flowing through sloughs south of the main channel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to slowly rise to near flood stage of 9.0 feet early this afternoon and remain there through this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. However, additional rainfall in the area today could result in changes to this forecast. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 04/25/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
